result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 7-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first 5 days - straight time - the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program. Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. Credit for 78 days time served. 

*****9-15-14 Judge Watts, Court ordered that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect a total of 78 days of sentence credit *****

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Wayne Sawyer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information received and filed.
Granting Motion for Sentence Credit (78 days), signed and filed. sab
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for sentence credit.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 11 months at the House of Correction - the first 5 days - straight time - the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 5 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 7-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to the amended charge and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended  Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 26.  Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Information and waives reading.  Court AMENDS the charge to Possession of Cocaine 961.41(3g)(c) an unclassified misdemeanor.
Filed by the State:  Amended Witness List.

Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7-14-14, 9:00 a.m.
Filed by the Defense:  Motions in Limine, Witness List.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 5/9/14 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Danielle Shelton 819 N 6th ST., Milwaukee, WI 53202.
Filed by the State:  Motion in Limine, Requested Jury Instructions, Witness List.

Attorney Danielle L Shelton in court, defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer not in court, in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Danielle L Shelton.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Paul Hauer for Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense requests sequestration of State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Claudio-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Isaac Wayne Sawyer in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
